wikitext.*:
<noinclude>{{month|February}}
Events that occurred on 15 February.
==On Earth==
</noinclude>
* '''[[1896]]''' - [[Arthur Tolkien]], [[J.R.R. Tolkien]]'s father, dies.
* '''[[1934]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]]'s poem "[[The Adventures of Tom Bombadil (poem)|The Adventures of Tom Bombadil]]" is published in ''The Oxford Magazine''.
* '''[[1949]]''' - Scholar [[Alexei Kondratiev]] is born.
* '''[[1991]]''' – The first "Colloquium on the Languages of Middle-earth" starts at the house of [[Elvish Linguistic Fellowship|E.L.F.]] member [[Bill Welden]]. It lasts until the [[18 February]].
* '''[[2008]]''' - ''[[The Lord of the Rings and the Western Narrative Tradition]]'' is published

==In Arda==
* {{TA|3019}}: 
** {{Cal Rest-Company}}
** [[Galadriel]] shows [[Frodo Baggins|Frodo]] and [[Samwise Gamgee|Sam]] the [[Mirror of Galadriel]].
** After his fight with the [[Durin's Bane|Balrog]], [[Gandalf]] returns to life.
** Last quarter of the Moon<noinclude><ref>{{HM|RC}}, p. xlix</ref>

==Other versions of the legendarium==
In earlier editions the [[Appendix B|Tale of Years]] lists the two events of {{TA|3019}} at [[14 February]]. Since it is clear from the narrative that the latter event occurred one day before departure on [[16 February]], this causes a problem in the chronology. In the ''[[The Lord of the Rings (50th Anniversary Edition)|50th Anniversary Edition]]'', [[Wayne G. Hammond|Hammond]] and [[Christina Scull|Scull]] decided to fix the Tale of Years so that the [[Mirror of Galadriel]]-sequence happened on 15 February. The return to life of [[Gandalf]] was also moved to today, for reasons unclear.
